articles.title: OpenAI in Talks for Share Sale Valuing Startup at $500 Billion
articles.summary: OpenAI is in early talks about a potential secondary sale of stock for current and former employees at a valuation of about $500 billion, people briefed on the investment discussions said, marking an enormous gain in value for the artificial intelligence leader.

articles.title: US Considers More Chip Tariffs | Bloomberg Tech 8/5/2025
articles.summary: Bloomberg‚Äôs Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss President Donald Trump‚Äôs comments that more chip tariffs may be coming soon. Plus, booming demand for artificial intelligence led Palantir‚Äôs revenue to climb above $1 billion. And AMD is under pressure to show benefits from the AI race as the chipmaker prepares to release earnings after markets close. (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: Super Micro (SMCI) Q4 earnings report 2025
articles.summary: The server maker's business is still getting a big boost from artificial intelligence, but growth is slowing.
articles.translated_summary: The server maker's business is still getting a big boost from artificial intelligence, but growth is slowing.

articles.title: AMD Gives Solid Forecast, Showing Strength of Demand for AI
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc., the second-largest maker of artificial intelligence processors, said the chipmaker‚Äôs return to the crucial China market is difficult to predict, overshadowing a generally upbeat forecast for its AI business.

articles.title: AI Boom Leads to Exploding Valuations
articles.summary: Demand for artificial intelligence has led to soaring valuations for some tech companies, even as US policy uncertainty remains. Stephanie Aliaga, global market strategist from JPMorgan‚Äôs Asset Management Market Insights Team, joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: Microsoft, EA, and other publishers should give up on artificial intelligence: We peaked 21 years ago, when Resident Evil 4 devs were thrilled AI enemies could think "like a smart person" by using "we
articles.summary: Chainsaws? I think you mean "undeniable genius"

articles.title: OpenAI, Google and Anthropic win US approval for civilian AI contracts
articles.summary: The US government's central purchasing arm is adding OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.'s Google and Anthropic to a list of approved artificial intelligence vendors, opening the door to widespread adoption of the technology across civilian federal agencies.

articles.title: AMD under pressure to show AI gains with stock beating Nvidia
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. earnings are expected to show the chipmaker is increasingly benefiting from the artificial intelligence arms race.

articles.title: OpenAI Releases Open-Weight Models After DeepSeek‚Äôs Success
articles.summary: OpenAI is releasing a pair of open and freely available artificial intelligence models that can mimic the human process of reasoning, months after China‚Äôs DeepSeek gained global attention with its own open AI software.
